Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance and intention behind the creation of the "Office of the President Elect" by Joe Biden.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the office was created to convince Americans that the election results were final when they weren't.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the creation of the "Office of the President Elect" was solely for political manipulation and misleading purposes.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation for the creation of the office, stating that it was a common practice and not unique to Biden, with examples of President Trump also using the same title.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the "Office of the President Elect" was not created by Biden, as it had been used before by previous presidents-elect.
Understate: The claim understates the efforts made by Biden and his team to prepare for the White House, as evidenced by their briefings and the website "buildbackbetter.com".
